attributes.action: Give Mackie Park a swing and reduce complaint power.
attributes.additional_details: While community projects should be ensured they are safe, it should be on the burden of the council to prove it is a bad thing for the community. Why should a single bad comment ruin the rest of a brilliant plan. Hopefully this will encourage Councils to be required to provide a minimum level of information into why community projects are removed, knowledge of who complained, and council by council voting and petitions to ensure a community ideal is kept
attributes.background: Mackie Park was given a swing by the community, however it was taken down to to a single complaint by someone in the community, while overwhelmingly the community feedback was positive. Why is negativity more important than positivity? It’s the wrong message.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is the responsibility of your local council.
	
You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:
https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
